title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Just started watching Guns and Gulaabs on Netflix.
Only Murders in the Building S3
if you are in for historical drama then should watch alias grace it's fictional and a Margret attwood book's adaptation (though I haven't read the book)

Not a web series or movie, but I recently finished up [this course/debate](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PL30C13C91CFFEFEA6) from a professor at Harvard University. I feel this is a must-watch as they take on to discuss different philosophies and what is just or unjust taking examples of all sorts of things like reservation, same-sex marriage etc.
Did you notice, they put Satish Kaushikâ€™s name on a Calender in end credits. Nice call back.

Just came across this amzing crime documentary youtube channel, SR Pay. The creator's name is Shrinkhal.

His narration is impeccable and does a thorough research of whatever case he is covering. 

It is addictive ngl. Should definitely be given a chance by people who are into this genre.
Just started the first episode and I'm hooked. Thanks for the recco.

True Crime Documentary.
(is that a genre in itself or not?? ðŸ˜­ I m clueless, sorry for the confusion lol)
Useful for me to understand what's the channel about!
